snippet: Critics of the memorial said the phrase, “I was a drum major for justice, peace and righteousness,” left out the context of words by the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.
abstract: Chinese sculptor Lei Yixin finishes removing contentious phrase on Washington, DC, memorial for Rev Dr Martin Luther King Jr in preparation for 50th anniversary of March on Washington; critics of memorial said phrase, 'I was a drum major for justice, peace and righteousness,' did not show true nature of full quotation.
lead_paragraph: Critics of the memorial said the phrase, “I was a drum major for justice, peace and righteousness,” left out the context of words by the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.

headline.main: Sculptor Removes Phrase From Memorial to King
headline.print_headline: Sculptor Removes Phrase From Memorial to King
